content.question: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 10 minus 6 times x squared, and denominator, 5 plus 3 times e to the x power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> is

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes
